Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payday loans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring institutions that provide payday loan or grant services and that conduct business with the city or its agencies, to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of interest rates and other charges in advertisements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.3480, to prohibit foreign banking corporations from issuing payday loans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibit foreign banking corporations from issuing payday loans.  (A3480)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to enact legislation to amend the current federal banking laws in order to allow states to better guard consumers from the potential risks of payday loans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the current federal banking laws to better protect consumers from the dangers of payday loans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services, and in the alternative, calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to require payday loan companies to disclose pertinent information in their advertisements.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payday loans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the current federal banking laws to better protect consumers from the dangers of payday loans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services, and in the alternative, calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to require payday loan companies to disclose pertinent information in their advertisements.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Nelson and Comrie
